FacilityStr2: 23 Miles North of Lakin on Hwy 27

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Cropland Co-op, Inc. is an agricultural retail business that specializes in grain storage for area producers as well as providing the necessary inputs for grain production. The Cropland Co-op, Inc. strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place. Our owners, managers, and employees have made every effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

The worst case and the alternate release scenarios have been evaluated and shared with our local first responders as part of an on-going training program. More importantly, our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. 

The Cropland Co-op, Inc. maintains and operates their Anhydrous Ammonia Plant in strict accordance with all state and local authorities. The Kansas Department of Agriculture (KDA) inspects our plant on a regular basis and we comply with their requests for improvement. Changes or improvements in the facility?s equipment will be acted upon immediately following the enforcement agency (KDA?s) request, or as found to be necessary by our staff.

Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site specific operating procedures, plant maintenance and employees are competency tested over the training material. Each employee uses ammonia proof goggles and gloves during ammonia operations as well ass always providing plenty of emergency safety water during nurse tank and maintenance operations. 

With the above-mentioned training in mind, it makes it very easy to report that absolutely no injury actions or property damage have occurred at this facility for the past 5 years. 

Our emergency action plan is designed to minimize the risks to employees, the surrounding public, and the area first responders.  The Cropland Co-op, Inc. provides plant tours for our local fire department and our action plan has been shared with the

Kearny County Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC). Each of our responding agencies are aware of the dangerous nature of anhydrous ammonia and they have agreed to assist us in the event of an emergency or accidental release.
